intro: Diplostephium canum, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its climbing habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It is native to Mexico and parts of Central America, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a garden plant.
